p.s: I'm Faraj al-Byarshan and I'm 41.
I'm an engineer who immigrated to New York from Iraq in 2005.
My wife and my two sons followed me in 2007.
And now I tell you something about that.
The reasons why we wanted to immigrate was the war in our country.
My family and I wasn'tweren't safe there.
Furthermore we wanted to immigrated because of the better life conditions in New York.
I immigrated first, because I wanted to find first a job and made us a home so then my wife and my sons could come to me.
But it was really hard.
Lots of bias against me and it needed time to find a job.
Two months I waited and I lived on the street.
But then I found a job, a really good job.
So I worked hard for two years and I bought a house.
Then my wife and my two sons came to New York.
First it was not sure if they could stay here totoo but I did all that they can stay.
And finally it worked.
We lived here and my two sons go to school.
At first they got teased at school but then I went to the class and tell them our story and how hard it was for us.
Since this day the kids respect my sons and thethey finally find friends.
My wife gets a job too that is really good thothough.
My hopes for the future were that the people don't judging you before they see you and what you experienced in your life.
I wish that my kids and maybe their kids have a good future without bias.
So that was my story and I hope you thankthink about what I say.
